en: The enterprise turned out to be a failure in the end.
zh: 这项事业最后还是失败了。

en: It was true, after all, that money did not bring happiness.
zh: 看来钱确实不能带来幸福。

en: She would be shocked if she were to know the result.
zh: 如果她知道了结果，肯定会吓一跳。

en: The results will not contradict the theory.
zh: 结果不会和理论相冲突的。

en: The results were negative.
zh: 结果是阴性的。

en: The result was contrary to his expectations.
zh: 结果和他预想的完全相反。

en: The result fell short of his expectation.
zh: 结果没达到他的预期。

en: The result was unsatisfactory to him.
zh: 他对这个结果不太满意。

en: Please let me know the results by telegram.
zh: 结果出来请发电报告诉我。

en: The results were as follows: Japan 1st; Spain 2nd; Italy 3rd.
zh: 结果如下：日本第一，西班牙第二，意大利第三。

en: The results were as follows.
zh: 结果如下。

en: The result was what I had expected.
zh: 结果不出我所料。

en: The results were far from satisfactory.
zh: 结果一点都不让人满意。

en: The results are by no means satisfactory.
zh: 结果绝不理想。

en: Don't worry about the results.
zh: 别担心结果。

en: The result proved disappointing.
zh: 结果挺让人失望的。

en: The results were in the main satisfactory.
zh: 结果基本上还算满意。

en: The result was contrary to our plan.
zh: 结果和我们的计划相反。

en: The result is neither good nor bad.
zh: 结果不好也不坏。

en: The result was clear at a glance.
zh: 结果一目了然。

en: It will not be long before we know the result.
zh: 很快就会知道结果了。

en: The outcome leaves nothing to be desired.
zh: 这个结果已经完美得无可挑剔了。

en: The result is still in doubt.
zh: 结果还不确定。

en: How did it come out?
zh: 结果怎么样？

en: Apart from the result, your intention was good.
zh: 撇开结果不谈，你的出发点是好的。

en: The result was rather disappointing.
zh: 结果挺让人失望的。

en: We'll let you know the result within a week.
zh: 我们一周之内会告诉你结果。

en: I was less than satisfied with the results.
zh: 我对结果不太满意。

en: As regards the result, you need not worry so much.
zh: 至于结果，你不用那么担心。

en: It ended up being canceled, but it gave us a chance to learn each other's feelings.
zh: 虽然最后取消了，但让我们有机会了解了彼此的心意。

en: The result is all that matters.
zh: 结果才是最重要的。

en: I will let you know after I have inquired once more.
zh: 我再去问一下，然后再告诉你。

en: We will report the results when known.
zh: 结果一出来我们就会汇报。

en: I will give you a call as soon as the decision comes through.
zh: 决定一出来我就给你打电话。

en: I'll let you know the result as soon as it is made public.
zh: 结果一公布我就告诉你。

en: I told you the result as soon as it was made public.
zh: 结果一公布我就告诉你了。

en: I am apprehensive of the outcome.
zh: 我对结果有些担心。

en: There are a lot of results and a calculation mistakes.
zh: 这里有很多错误结果和计算失误。

en: What has many holes but is good for holding liquid?
zh: 什么东西全是洞却能装水？

en: I wish I could sink through the floor.
zh: 我真想找个地缝钻进去。

en: I'm so embarrassed I could dig a hole and crawl into it.
zh: 我尴尬得想挖个洞钻进去。

en: One finding to emerge was that critical features differ between species.
zh: 研究发现，不同物种之间的关键特征是不同的。

en: You should acquaint yourself with the facts before you make a decision.
zh: 做决定之前你应该先了解一下事实。

en: The decision belongs to him.
zh: 决定权在他手里。

en: Let me put off my decision.
zh: 让我推迟一下决定吧。

en: The decision rests with him.
zh: 这事儿由他说了算。

en: Let's leave the decision to our teacher.
zh: 咱们让老师来做决定吧。

en: It rests with you to decide.
zh: 这事儿得由你来定。

en: The decision was put off, which pleased all of us.
zh: 决定推迟了，我们大家都很高兴。

en: The decision was put off.
zh: 决定推迟了。

en: Let's leave the decision to Tom.
zh: 让汤姆来决定吧。

en: I'll leave the decision to you.
zh: 由你来决定吧。

en: I want quick action subsequent to the decision.
zh: 决定之后，我希望能尽快采取行动。

en: Try to take account of everything before you make a decision.
zh: 做决定之前，尽量把方方面面都考虑到。

en: It's up to you to decide.
zh: 你说了算。

en: What we had to decide was when to open the meeting.
zh: 我们当时得定下来什么时候开会。

en: The day of decision is at hand.
zh: 做决定的日子就要到了。

en: Reflect on advantages and disadvantages before you make up your mind.
zh: 下决心之前，先权衡一下利弊。

en: Now that you have made your decision, you must act.
zh: 既然你已经决定了，就得行动起来。

en: I couldn't decide what to do, so I just followed my heart.
zh: 我不知道该怎么办，所以就随心而行了。

en: The final game was postponed to tomorrow.
zh: 决赛推迟到明天了。

en: The final match was not so exciting.
zh: 决赛没那么精彩。

en: The gold cup was given to the winner of the final match.
zh: 奖杯发给了决赛的获胜者。

en: Nothing is more disappointing than to lose in the finals.
zh: 没什么比决赛输掉更让人失望的了。

en: Each team carried their flag into the stadium for the finals.
zh: 每个队都扛着队旗进场参加决赛。

en: Five runners reached the finals.
zh: 有五名选手进入了决赛。

en: We will now report on this year's business results.
zh: 我们现在来汇报一下今年的业绩。

en: Abide by your promise.
zh: 遵守你的诺言。

en: Before deciding, I would like to consult with my family.
zh: 做决定之前，我想先跟家里人商量一下。

en: Let's consider the problem in all its bearings before making a decision.
zh: 做决定前，咱们还是把问题全方位地考虑一下吧。

en: I decided. I'm going to ask him out tonight.
zh: 我决定了，今晚约他出去。

en: A formula is very convenient, because you need not think about it.
zh: 套公式很方便，因为不用怎么动脑子。

en: Please let me know as soon as it's decided.
zh: 一定下来就请告诉我。

en: Never break your promise.
zh: 千万不要违背诺言。

en: You must stick to your diet.
zh: 你得坚持你的饮食计划。

en: He's by no means satisfied.
zh: 他一点也不满意。

en: Never let me go.
zh: 永远不要离开我。

en: He is by no means a pleasant fellow to associate with.
zh: 他绝对不是一个容易相处的人。

en: It is not possible to be free from every sort of disease.
zh: 人不可能一辈子不生病。

en: Never take advantage of another's misfortune.
zh: 千万不要趁人之危。

en: I advise you never to live beyond your income.
zh: 我建议你千万不要入不敷出。

en: It is far from a joke.
zh: 这可一点都不好笑。

en: I am by no means satisfied with my present income.
zh: 我对我现在的收入一点都不满意。

en: Never judge by appearance.
zh: 千万不要以貌取人。

en: Never tell a lie.
zh: 永远不要撒谎。

en: Under no circumstances can the scheme be put into practice.
zh: 这个方案无论如何都行不通。

en: You should on no account cheat in the exam.
zh: 考试绝对不能作弊。

en: Didn't you promise never to tell a lie?
zh: 你不是答应过绝对不撒谎吗？

en: It is a virtue never to tell a lie.
zh: 从不撒谎是一种美德。

en: For all his faults, he is a good fellow.
zh: 尽管他有很多缺点，但他人挺好的。

en: No man is without his faults.
zh: 谁都有缺点。

en: Despite all his faults he is popular.
zh: 尽管他一身毛病，但还挺受欢迎的。

en: Despite all his faults, everybody likes him.
zh: 尽管他有很多缺点，大家还是都很喜欢他。

en: I love him despite his faults.
zh: 尽管他有缺点，我还是爱他。

en: Please inform me of your absence in advance.
zh: 如果你不能来，请提前跟我说一声。

en: No students were absent.
zh: 没有学生缺席。

en: There wasn't one student who was absent.
zh: 没一个学生缺席。

en: Let's drink to absent friends.
zh: 让我们为没到场的朋友们干一杯。

en: He has been absent from work for a week.
zh: 他已经一个星期没来上班了。

en: The compromise which permits a smoker to smoke in the smoking corner was born after heated discussion.
zh: 经过激烈讨论，双方终于达成妥协，允许吸烟者在吸烟区吸烟。

en: After a heated discussion, a compromise was adopted. Smokers will be allowed to smoke in the smoking corner.
zh: 经过一番激烈的讨论，最后达成了妥协：烟民可以在吸烟角抽烟。

en: The hard work has run him down.
zh: 繁重的工作把他给累垮了。

en: It's raining hard.
zh: 雨下得很大。

en: Since it was raining, Nancy hesitated to go out.
zh: 因为在下雨，南希在犹豫要不要出门。

en: A loud knocking at the door woke him up.
zh: 巨大的敲门声把他惊醒了。

en: We have to be prepared to cope with violent storms.
zh: 我们必须做好应对暴风雨的准备。

en: There was a sharp peal of thunder.
zh: 突然响起了雷声。

en: The wild wind was blowing.
zh: 狂风呼啸着。

en: A fierce battle was fought by the soldiers.
zh: 士兵们打了一场恶战。

en: In spite of the heavy snow, she came all the way to the station.
zh: 尽管雪下得很大，她还是大老远跑到了车站。

en: The mountaineers set off, paying no heed to the severe blizzard.
zh: 登山队员们没管暴风雪有多大，还是出发了。

en: Vigorous exercise makes you sweat.
zh: 剧烈运动会让你出汗。

en: The heavy rain prevented them from going there.
zh: 大雨让他们没法去那儿。

en: It rained heavily all day.
zh: 雨下了一整天。

en: Fiscal austerity is considered to be an answer to the rampant inflation.
zh: 财政紧缩被认为是解决恶性通货膨胀的方法。

en: It's a shoot-'em-up western.
zh: 那是一部打打杀杀的西部片。

en: When the shooting died down a bit, Daddy ran over to our flat and brought us back some sandwiches.
zh: 枪声小了一点后，爸爸跑回我们的公寓，给我们带了些三明治。

en: If you get shot, you'll die.
zh: 你要是中弹了，就死定了。

en: The shooting started around noon.
zh: 枪战是中午左右开始的。

en: Shot, huh?
zh: 中枪了，是吧？

en: Were you shot?
zh: 你中弹了吗？

en: Have you been shot?
zh: 你被打中了吗？

en: On my way to the theater I saw a traffic accident.
zh: 在去剧院的路上，我看到了一起交通事故。

en: There is a parking lot behind the theater.
zh: 剧院后面有个停车场。

en: He looked just like his picture on the wall of the theater.
zh: 他长得和他挂在剧院墙上的照片一模一样。

en: The words above the door of the theatre were a metre high.
zh: 剧院门上的字有一米高。

en: The words above the door of the theater were one meter high.
zh: 剧院门上方的字有一米高。

en: Let's meet in front of the theater.
zh: 我们在剧院门口见吧。

en: Theater attendance usually falls off in summer.
zh: 夏天去剧院看戏的人通常会变少。

en: I found the theater crowded.
zh: 我发现剧院里挤满了人。

en: I met Yoko on my way to the theater.
zh: 我在去剧院的路上碰到了洋子。

en: We ran out of gas on the way to the theater.
zh: 我们在去剧院的路上车子没油了。

en: There was a large audience in the theater.
zh: 剧院里观众很多。

en: There was a large audience at the theater.
zh: 剧院里的人特别多。

en: At the theater, Kathy changed seats with her mother.
zh: 在剧院里，凯西和她妈妈换了座位。

en: A stream of people came out of the theater.
zh: 人群从剧院里涌了出来。

en: The play began exactly on time.
zh: 演出准时开始了。

en: The play was very amusing; you ought to have gone there.
zh: 那场戏挺有意思的，你当时要是去了就好了。

en: The play went very well on the whole.
zh: 演出总的来说很顺利。

en: What time does the play start?
zh: 戏几点开演？

en: The comic scenes in the play were overdone.
zh: 戏里的喜剧桥段演得有点过火了。

en: Did you ever see a whale?
zh: 你见过鲸鱼吗？

en: Whales are classified as mammals.
zh: 鲸鱼被划分为哺乳动物。

en: A whale is a mammal.
zh: 鲸鱼是哺乳动物。

en: Whales are mammals.
zh: 鲸鱼属于哺乳动物。

en: The whale is a mammal.
zh: 鲸鱼是一种哺乳动物。

en: A whale is a mammal; in other words it feeds milk to its young.
zh: 鲸鱼是哺乳动物，换句话说，它用奶水哺育幼崽。

en: Unless whales are protected, they will become extinct.
zh: 如果不保护鲸鱼，它们就会灭绝。

en: The whale is the largest animal on the earth.
zh: 鲸鱼是地球上体型最大的动物。

en: Whales feed on small fish.
zh: 鲸鱼以小鱼为食。

en: The whale is well known to be the largest mammal.
zh: 大家都知道鲸鱼是最大的哺乳动物。

en: Whales are similar to fishes in shape.
zh: 鲸鱼的长相跟鱼挺像的。

en: Whales are similar to fish in shape.
zh: 鲸鱼的长相跟鱼挺像的。

en: It was believed that whales were fish.
zh: 以前大家都觉得鲸鱼是鱼类。

en: The whale is not a fish but a mammal.
zh: 鲸鱼不是鱼，而是哺乳动物。

en: Whales feed on plankton and small fish.
zh: 鲸鱼吃浮游生物和小鱼。

en: The whale is a very large mammal which lives in the sea.
zh: 鲸鱼是生活在海里的超大哺乳动物。

en: Whales are very large mammals that live in the ocean.
zh: 鲸鱼是生活在大海里的超大哺乳动物。

en: The whale is a very large mammal who lives in the sea.
zh: 鲸鱼是生活在海里的超大哺乳动物。

en: It is believed that whales have their own language.
zh: 大家都觉得鲸鱼有自己的语言。

en: As likely as not, whales will be extinct by the end of this century.
zh: 很有可能到这个世纪末鲸鱼就灭绝了。

en: I'm being picked up.
zh: 有人来接我。

en: Thank you very much for coming to see me.
zh: 谢谢你能来看我。

en: Shall I come for you?
zh: 要我来接你吗？

en: The work of art, I decided, was the final product of human activity, and the final justification for all the misery, the endless toil and the frustrated strivings of humanity.
zh: 我觉得艺术品是人类活动的最终产物，也让所有的痛苦、辛劳和挫折有了意义。

en: An artist must have an eye for color.
zh: 艺术家得对颜色很敏感。

en: Some artists are contemptuous of criticism.
zh: 有些艺术家根本不在乎别人的批评。

en: To the eye of an artist, this is valuable, I hear.
zh: 听说在艺术家眼里，这东西挺值钱的。

en: No cultural background is necessary to understand art.
zh: 看懂艺术不需要什么文化背景。

en: Art is not a luxury, but a necessity.
zh: 艺术不是奢侈品，而是生活必需品。

en: Art isn't a luxury, but a necessity.
zh: 艺术不是奢侈品，而是生活必需品。

en: Art is long, life is short.
zh: 艺术永恒，生命短暂。

en: Art is my lifework.
zh: 艺术是我一辈子的事业。

en: Art breaks the monotony of our life.
zh: 艺术打破了我们生活的单调。

en: It requires a good taste to study art.
zh: 搞艺术得有好的品味。

en: Art is loved by everybody.
zh: 大家都喜欢艺术。

en: Art for art's sake.
zh: 为艺术而艺术。

en: I have known intimately a great many persons who were absorbed in the arts.
zh: 我跟很多痴迷艺术的人都挺熟的。

en: Accomplishments are a friend in need.
zh: 有一技之长，困难时就有靠山。

en: Art brings bread.
zh: 艺术也能糊口。

en: Which do you like better, chicken or fish?
zh: 鸡肉和鱼，你更喜欢吃哪个？

en: Better be the head of a dog than the tail of a lion.
zh: 宁为鸡头，不为凤尾。

en: The crowing of a cock is the harbinger of dawn.
zh: 鸡叫声预示着天快亮了。

en: Feed chickens with seeds.
zh: 给鸡喂点种子。

en: Do not answer hastily.
zh: 别急着回答。

en: Don't behave lightly.
zh: 举止别太轻浮。

en: Carelessness is his principle feature.
zh: 他最大的特点就是粗心。

en: Is there a cafe where I can have a light meal?
zh: 这附近有没有能吃点便餐的咖啡馆？

en: Enjoy the experience of a relaxing day at Karuizawa.
zh: 在轻井泽过上轻松的一天吧。

en: Fried eggs, sunny-side up, easy please.
zh: 煎蛋，太阳蛋，嫩一点。

en: I had a very good time at Karuizawa.
zh: 我在轻井泽玩得很开心。

en: Karuizawa is famous as a summer resort.
zh: 轻井泽是很有名的避暑胜地。

en: Let's catch a bite.
zh: 咱们随便吃点吧。

en: A snack will stay your hunger.
zh: 吃点零食垫垫底。

en: It's only a slight cold.
zh: 只是有点小感冒。

en: A slight cold prevented me from going to Ibusuki with my family.
zh: 我因为一点小感冒没能跟家里人一起去指宿。

en: I had a light lunch.
zh: 我午饭吃得很清淡。

en: Don't go onto the crossing when the alarm is ringing.
zh: 警报响的时候别过道口。

en: Don't cross the tracks when the alarm is ringing.
zh: 警报响的时候别跨铁轨。

en: Sergeant, try to keep a lid on the situation until we can get more police down there.
zh: 警官，在增援赶到之前，尽量把场面控制住。

en: Guards are stationed 'round the clock at the Imperial Palace in Tokyo.
zh: 东京皇居全天都有守卫值班。

en: He went into the bank in the disguise of a guard.
zh: 他伪装成保安进了银行。

en: He entered the bank disguised as a guard.
zh: 他假扮成保安进了银行。

en: The guards rotated in making their rounds every hour.
zh: 守卫们每小时轮换巡逻一次。

en: The guardsman was assaulted by a robber.
zh: 那个卫兵被抢劫犯袭击了。

en: The police considered the crime to be serious.
zh: 警方认为这起罪行很严重。

en: The cruelty of the torture in the police station is beyond description.
zh: 警察局里的酷刑残忍得简直没法用语言形容。

en: Tell me where the police station is.
zh: 告诉我警察局在哪儿。

en: Please tell me where the police station is.
zh: 请告诉我警察局在哪儿。

en: The police accused him of murder.
zh: 警方指控他谋杀。

en: Policemen work at the risk of their own lives.
zh: 警察工作时是冒着生命危险的。

en: The policeman demanded their names and addresses.
zh: 警察要求他们报上姓名和地址。

en: The cop went through his pockets, but found nothing.
zh: 警察搜了他的口袋，但啥也没发现。

en: The policeman signaled him to stop.
zh: 警察打手势让他停下。

en: "What are you going to do with the money?", asked the policeman.
zh: “你打算拿这笔钱干什么？”警察问。

en: The policeman seized the boy by the arm.
zh: 警察一把拽住了那个男孩的胳膊。

en: The policeman blamed me for ignoring traffic rules.
zh: 警察责备我不遵守交通规则。

en: The policeman told me that the last bus leaves at ten.
zh: 警察告诉我末班车十点发车。

en: The police searched for the missing child.
zh: 警方搜寻了失踪的孩子。

en: Policemen aren't permitted to drink on duty.
zh: 警察执勤时是不允许喝酒的。

en: The police aren't allowed to drink on duty.
zh: 警察值勤时是不让喝酒的。

en: The police asked the girl to make a rough sketch of her lost dog.
zh: 警察让那个女孩把她丢的狗画个草图。

en: The police promised to look into the matter.
zh: 警方答应会调查这件事。

en: The police started to look into the murder case.
zh: 警方开始调查这起谋杀案。

en: The police began to go into the murder case.
zh: 警方开始着手调查这桩命案。

en: An important function of policemen is to catch thieves.
zh: 警察的一项重要职责就是抓小偷。

en: Not all policemen are brave.

zh: 我想请你参加派对。

en: If I scold you, it is that I want you to improve.
zh: 我责备你也是为了让你进步。

en: I cannot praise you enough.
zh: 我怎么夸你都不够。

en: I'll sue you.
zh: 我要告你。

en: I've been waiting for you for three hours!
zh: 我都等你三个小时了！

en: You must make decisions about your responsibility in the light of your conscience.
zh: 你得凭良心对自己的责任做决定。

en: You acted after your nature. Think of all the trouble you would give him.
zh: 你就是按自己的性子来，想想你会给他添多少麻烦。

en: I wish you could have been there.
zh: 你要是当时在那儿就好了。

en: You share his interest in this book?
zh: 你也跟他一样喜欢这本书？

en: Will you join us?
zh: 要加入我们吗？

en: I am not any more to blame than you are.
zh: 我不比你更有错。

en: Now you have come of age, you should seek a living for yourself.
zh: 你已经成年了，该自己谋生了。

en: It's time you looked ahead.
zh: 你该往前看了。

en: Both you and I are college graduates.
zh: 咱俩都是大学毕业生。

en: You're taking on the company style.
zh: 你越来越有公司的风格了。

en: Check it out!
zh: 瞧瞧！

en: Both you and your brother are wrong.
zh: 你和你兄弟都错了。

en: I wish you could have come with me.
zh: 要是你当时能跟我一起来就好了。

en: I wish you could've come with me.
zh: 要是你当时能跟我一起来就好了。

en: Would you like to come along?
zh: 想一起来吗？

en: Would you care to come with us?
zh: 愿意跟我们一起去吗？

en: Since you have already also become an adult, you must become independent economically from your parents.
zh: 既然你也成年了，经济上就得脱离父母独立。

en: It is time you got married.
zh: 你该结婚了。

en: You will soon be used to living in a big city.
zh: 你很快就会习惯大城市的生活了。

en: It's your first time doing this kind of work. You should follow the manual exactly until you get more experience.
zh: 你第一次做这种活儿，在有经验之前，最好严格按照手册来。

en: You, too, should have seen that movie.
zh: 你也该看那部电影的。

en: You must never resort to force.
zh: 你绝不能诉诸武力。

en: Do you get up at six?
zh: 你六点起床吗？

en: You are too young to be in love.
zh: 你还太小，谈恋爱太早了。

en: Will you go by train?
zh: 你坐火车去吗？

en: You may catch sight of our house from the train.
zh: 在火车上也许能看见我家。

en: You must not look down upon parents' advice.
zh: 你不能不把父母的建议当回事。

en: You lean on your parents too much. You must be more independent.
zh: 你太依赖父母了，得独立点。

en: You should be more considerate of your parents.
zh: 你应该多体谅体谅你父母。

en: You have to obey your parents.
zh: 你得听父母的话。

en: You speak fluent English.
zh: 你英语说得很流利。

en: You're such a clothes horse.
zh: 你可真爱打扮。

en: You're ill with flu.
zh: 你得流感了。

en: You are expected to do a good job.
zh: 大家都指望你能把活儿干好。

en: You didn't need to come.
zh: 你其实不用来的。

en: You are not coming, are you?
zh: 你不来了，对吧？

en: You should prepare your lessons.
zh: 你该预习一下功课。

en: Must you go to the post office?
zh: 你非得去邮局吗？

en: Do you have to go to the post office?
zh: 你必须去邮局吗？

en: You aren't afraid of ghosts, are you?
zh: 你不怕鬼，对吧？

en: You may as well ask your friend for advice.
zh: 你不如问问朋友的建议。

en: You're very brave, aren't you?
zh: 你挺勇敢的，不是吗？

en: He is a merry fellow.
zh: 他是个乐天派。

en: She continued that you should keep your promise.
zh: 她接着说，你应该守信用。

en: You should keep your promise.
zh: 你应该守信用。

en: You must bind yourself to keep your promise.
zh: 你必须保证信守诺言。

en: It is essential that you present yourself at the office.
zh: 你必须得亲自去趟办公室。

en: You don't do a useful snitch of work.
zh: 你一点正经活儿都不干。

en: Do you belong to the baseball club?
zh: 你是棒球俱乐部的吗？

en: Are you a member of the baseball team?
zh: 你是棒球队的吗？

en: You are a troublemaker.
zh: 你真是个麻烦精。

en: I took it for granted that you would come to my party.
zh: 我原以为你肯定会来参加我的派对。

en: You have only to close your eyes.
zh: 你只要闭上眼睛就行。

en: You have only to sit in silence.
zh: 你只要安静地坐着就行。

en: You might be wise to remain silent.
zh: 你最好还是保持沉默。

en: You'd better not go to school tomorrow.
zh: 你明天最好别去学校。

en: You will be allowed to use this room tomorrow.
zh: 明天你可以使用这间房间。

en: You will have to get up at six tomorrow morning.
zh: 你明天早上得六点起床。

en: You must choose between honor and death.
zh: 你必须在荣誉和死亡之间做个选择。

en: You are pushing matters.
zh: 你有点咄咄逼人了。

en: Can't you divorce fantasy from reality?
zh: 你分不清幻想和现实吗？

en: You can't separate dreams from reality?
zh: 你分不清梦境和现实吗？

en: Because you're a minor, you can't enter.
zh: 因为你是未成年人，所以不能进入。

en: Since you're a minor, you aren't allowed to enter.
zh: 既然你是未成年人，就不准进入。

en: Are you satisfied with your daily life?
zh: 你对现在的日常生活满意吗？

en: Do you have to go there every day?
zh: 你每天都得去那儿吗？

en: You don't have to come here every day.
zh: 你不用每天都来这儿。

en: All you have to do is to tell the truth.
zh: 你只要说实话就行。

en: Do you really believe in ghosts?
zh: 你真的相信有鬼吗？

en: Do you really believe ghosts exist?
zh: 你真的相信世上有鬼？

en: You are a really good secretary. If you didn't take care of everything, I couldn't do anything. You are just great.
zh: 你真是个优秀的秘书。要是没你打理这一切，我什么都做不了。你真了不起。

en: I wonder if you can really try.
zh: 我在想你是不是真的能试试看。

en: You certainly play the piano well.
zh: 你钢琴弹得真好。

en: Are you in earnest in saying so?
zh: 你这么说是认真的吗？

en: Are you serious about what you're saying?
zh: 你说的是认真的吗？

en: You're a bookworm.
zh: 你真是个书呆子。

en: Did you pay for the book?
zh: 你付过那本书的钱了吗？

en: All you have to do is believe me.
zh: 你只要相信我就行。

en: You've got me behind the eight ball.
zh: 你可把我难住了。

en: You don't need to call me.
zh: 你不用给我打电话。

en: How dare you say such a thing to me!
zh: 你竟敢对我这样说话！

en: Are you angry because of what I said?
zh: 你是因为我刚才说的话生气了吗？

en: You are a busy man, so I will adjust my schedule to yours.
zh: 你是位忙人，我就按你的时间来安排吧。

en: You've bought more stamps than needed.
zh: 你邮票买多了。

en: You've bought more stamps than necessary.
zh: 你买的邮票比实际需要的还多。

en: Aren't you tired?
zh: 你不累吗？

en: You need to apologize to her and need to do it right away.
zh: 你得跟她道歉，而且得马上。

en: You must apologize to her, and do it at once.
zh: 你必须向她道歉，立刻就去。

en: You told her that you had finished the work three days ago.
zh: 你跟她说你三天前就把工作做完了。

en: I think you'd better go and visit him.
zh: 我觉得你最好去看看他。

en: I think you should visit him.
zh: 我觉得你应该去拜访他。

en: You didn't need to see him to the door.
zh: 你其实不用送他到门口。

en: There was no need for you to see him to the door.
zh: 你没必要送他到门口的。

en: It wasn't necessary for you to see him to the door.
zh: 没必要非让你送他到门口。

en: You must pay regard to his advice.
zh: 你必须重视他的建议。

en: You should've taken his advice.
zh: 你当时要是听了他的建议就好了。

en: You may use his library.
zh: 你可以用他的书房。

en: You shouldn't worry about his eccentricities.
zh: 你不用在意他的那些怪癖。

en: You shouldn't pay any attention to his eccentricities.
zh: 你不必理会他那些古怪的行为。
